intro: Mecodium cuneatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf mecodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are often pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Mecodium cuneatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
